struct  Buffer

Detailed Description

The BufferManager is a singleton (i.e. a static class) with static methods only. It will created at boot time and will be present until the system will be shutdown.

Member Function Documentation

BufferPoolManager::ResultType BufferPoolManager::CreateBufferPool (  UINT8 &  buff_count,
UINT32  buff_len,
UINT32 &  pool_handle
) 
 

Creates a new buffer pool. The application which creates the buffer pool is responsible to delete it later.

Parameters:
buff_count [IN] Number of requested buffers. [OUT] Number of actually allocated buffers (might be smaller than the requested one).
buff_len [IN] Length of each buffer in byte.
buff_ptr_array [OUT] Pointer to buffer array, containing buff_count buffers.
pool_handle [OUT] Handle to the created buffer pool. It just a magic number to identify the pool
Returns:

BufferPoolManager::ResultType BufferPoolManager::DeleteBufferPool (  UINT32 &  pool_handle  ) 
 

Deletes an existing buffer pool. Typically the application which has created the buffer pool is responsible to delete it also. After deletion of a specific buffer pool no application/device can get any buffer from this pool any longer.

Parameters:
pool_handle [IN] Handle to the buffer pool to be deleted. [OUT] Return value is NULL if pool is successfully deleted. In case of an error the pool_handle will not be modified
Returns:

BufferPoolManager::ResultType BufferPoolManager::GetBuffer (  UINT32  pool_handle,
UINT8 HUGE *&  buff_ptr
) 
 

Gets a reference (pointer) to any free buffer. The buffer manager returns a pointer the any free buffer, which is available in the given buffer pool.

Parameters:
pool_handle [IN] Handle to the buffer pool from which a free buffer shall be obtained.
buff_ptr [OUT] Pointer to the returned buffer.
Returns:

BufferPoolManager::ResultType BufferPoolManager::GetBufferPoolStatus (  UINT32  pool_handle,
UINT8 &  free_buff_count
) 
 

Retrieves the amount of free buffers in the given Buffer pool

Parameters:
pool_handle [IN] Handle to the buffer pool to be queried
free_buff_count [OUT] Free buffer count
Returns:

BufferPoolManager * BufferPoolManager::GetInstance (   )  [static]
 

BufferPoolManager::ResultType BufferPoolManager::ReleaseBuffer (  UINT8 HUGE *&  buff_ptr  ) 
 

Releases one or more buffer(s) (typically of one specific type, i.e. buffers belonging to the same pool). A released buffer can be returned by the BufferManager if someone calls BufferManager::GetBuffer(...)

Parameters:
buff_ptr [IN] Pointer to an buffer which shall be released. The buffer is provided by the caller and passed as reference to the method.
